bug.author: dongdan39
bug.summary: Neither v0.5.0 nor v0.5.1 works when spawning "NewServer".
bug.description:
Dear Developers, I found neither v0.5.0 nor v0.5.1 works when spawning "NEW SERVER" on "Notebook Servers", simply no response when clicking on the button. I installed my kubeflow following instructions from: <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/</denchmark-link>
[root@centos-7-vm-1 lin]# kubectl get deploy -n kubeflow NAME DESIRED CURRENT UP-TO-DATE AVAILABLE AGE ambassador 3 3 3 3 40h argo-ui 1 1 1 1 40h centraldashboard 1 1 1 1 40h jupyter-web-app 1 1 1 1 40h katib-ui 1 1 1 1 40h minio 1 1 1 1 40h ml-pipeline 1 1 1 1 40h ml-pipeline-persistenceagent 1 1 1 1 40h ml-pipeline-scheduledworkflow 1 1 1 1 40h ml-pipeline-ui 1 1 1 1 40h ml-pipeline-viewer-controller-deployment 1 1 1 1 40h mysql 1 1 1 1 40h notebooks-controller 1 1 1 1 40h pytorch-operator 1 1 1 1 40h studyjob-controller 1 1 1 1 40h tensorboard 1 1 1 1 40h tf-job-dashboard 1 1 1 1 40h tf-job-operator 1 1 1 1 40h vizier-core 1 1 1 1 40h vizier-core-rest 1 1 1 1 40h vizier-db 1 1 1 1 40h vizier-suggestion-bayesianoptimization 1 1 1 1 40h vizier-suggestion-grid 1 1 1 1 40h vizier-suggestion-hyperband 1 1 1 1 40h vizier-suggestion-random 1 1 1 1 40h workflow-controller 1 1 1 1 40h Note that other dashboards works normally. Please check, thanks! Cheers, Dan

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.70. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
P.S: I did pass --version=v0.5.0 or v0.5.1 when kfctl init, but it does not work.

Can you provide the YAML for your jupyter web app ? <denchmark-code>kubectl get deploy -o yaml jupyter-web-app </denchmark-code>
When you click on new server what happens? Do you see the form to create a new notebook? If nothing happens can you use the chrome developer tools (or equivalent in your browser) to see if there are javascript errors. /assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kimwnasptd>@kimwnasptd</denchmark-link>

Can you provide the YAML for your jupyter web app ? kubectl get deploy -o yaml jupyter-web-app
When you click on new server what happens? Do you see the form to create a new notebook? If nothing happens can you use the chrome developer tools (or equivalent in your browser) to see if there are javascript errors. /assign @kimwnasptd
When clicking on new server, nothing happens. No errors found. [root@centos-7-vm-1 lin]# kubectl -n kubeflow logs jupyter-web-app-5fd56df98c-tkd9b
Serving Flask app "kubeflow_jupyter.default.app" (lazy loading) Environment: production WARNING: Do not use the development server in a production environment. Use a production WSGI server instead. Debug mode: off Running on http://0.0.0.0:5000/ (Press CTRL+C to quit) 10.244.4.130 - - [16/May/2019 01:13:13] "GET / HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.244.4.130 - - [16/May/2019 01:13:14] "GET /static/css/main.css HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.244.2.128 - - [16/May/2019 01:13:14] "GET /static/css/dialog.css HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.244.5.142 - - [16/May/2019 01:13:14] "GET /static/js/dialog.js HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.244.4.130 - - [16/May/2019 01:13:14] "GET /static/js/notebooks.js HTTP/1.1" 200 -
[root@centos-7-vm-1 lin]# kubectl -n kubeflow get deploy -o yaml jupyter-web-app apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1 kind: Deployment metadata: annotations: deployment.kubernetes.io/revision: "1" ksonnet.io/managed: '{"pristine":""}' kubecfg.ksonnet.io/garbage-collect-tag: gc-tag creationTimestamp: 2019-05-16T00:59:20Z generation: 1 labels: app: jupyter-web-app app.kubernetes.io/deploy-manager: ksonnet ksonnet.io/component: jupyter-web-app name: jupyter-web-app namespace: kubeflow resourceVersion: "29202031" selfLink: /apis/extensions/v1beta1/namespaces/kubeflow/deployments/jupyter-web-app uid: d63ee7f8-7775-11e9-ae91-fa163e24b7d2 spec: progressDeadlineSeconds: 600 replicas: 1 revisionHistoryLimit: 10 selector: matchLabels: app: jupyter-web-app strategy: rollingUpdate: maxSurge: 25% maxUnavailable: 25% type: RollingUpdate template: metadata: creationTimestamp: null labels: app: jupyter-web-app spec: containers: - env: - name: ROK_SECRET_NAME value: secret-rok-{username} - name: UI value: default image: gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/jupyter-web-app:v0.5.0 imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent name: jupyter-web-app ports: - containerPort: 5000 protocol: TCP resources: {} terminationMessagePath: /dev/termination-log terminationMessagePolicy: File volumeMounts: - mountPath: /etc/config name: config-volume dnsPolicy: ClusterFirst restartPolicy: Always schedulerName: default-scheduler securityContext: {} serviceAccount: jupyter-web-app serviceAccountName: jupyter-web-app terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30 volumes: - configMap: defaultMode: 420 name: jupyter-web-app-config name: config-volume status: availableReplicas: 1 conditions:
lastTransitionTime: 2019-05-16T01:02:16Z lastUpdateTime: 2019-05-16T01:02:16Z message: Deployment has minimum availability. reason: MinimumReplicasAvailable status: "True" type: Available lastTransitionTime: 2019-05-16T00:59:20Z lastUpdateTime: 2019-05-16T01:02:16Z message: ReplicaSet "jupyter-web-app-5fd56df98c" has successfully progressed. reason: NewReplicaSetAvailable status: "True" type: Progressing observedGeneration: 1 readyReplicas: 1 replicas: 1 updatedReplicas: 1
====== BTW, I tested that everything works perfectly with version 0.4.1. Not clear what happens to 0.5.0 and 0.5.1. Cheers, Dan
Turns out to be a network firewall problem when downloading a *.js script. Sorry for this confusion, please close this issue. Thanks!
